column5: looking to take our sons to a different local to fish this summer. We are thinking about Manitoba,we would be driving from central Iowa. Any suggestions on lake and resort would be much appreciated. We will be towing our boat. Thanks much!

The best fishing you will find is up in the Snow Lake Flin Flon area in Northern Manitoba loads of top lakes for Lake Trout, Pike and Walleye I fish this area's all summer and there are allot of anglers here from your state. Lakes to consider are Reed Lake,Athapapuskow, Kissising, Tramping lake,Clearwater,Cormorant,Iskwasum,Simon House,Come June and early July these are the best times. The drive will be worth it. Hope this helps? NMhttp://www.xtremesportfishing.com/forum
nm is right for multi species for walleyes with a shorter drive also would suggest lake of the prairies or cedar lake

If you go to kississing, be sure your rig is up to it. 40 miles one way of mediocre to low grade gravel road makes for havoc on trailers, tires, axles, you name it...let alone the dust. Many a trailer has lost an axle on that road...but it is well worth it once you are there. Steve
We have been going to Wekusko Falls Lodge on Tramping Lake. Big walleyes and pike.http://www.wekuskofallslodge.com/index.html Contact me for more info. I live in Robins, near Cedar Rapids.
We trailer in to Reed Lake for the opener every Spring, but there are many good lakes to choose from. Nice big campground at Reed also, no electricity tho. Kilroy
